Description: Manulife Financial Corporation, a Canadian-based insurance and financial services company, agreed to pay a $1 million civil penalty to settle charges that the company violated antitrust premerger notification requirements when it acquired more than $50 million of John Hancock common stock in the spring of 2003.

Description: failure to pay out-of-state business registration fee
John Hancock Life Insurance Co. agreed to pay more than $550,000 in refunds in settlement of allegations it failed to properly supervise one of its representatives.
John Hancock Life agreed to pay $3 million to settle multistate litigation regarding its use of the Social Security Administration's Death Master File.
Info Source: John Hancock Pays $3M in Settlement, States News Service, May 19, 2011 (via Nexis).

Company: John Hancock Life Insurance Co. (USA) et al.
Description: John Hancock Life Insurance Company (USA), John Hancock Life and Health Insurance Company of New Yorks, and John Hancock Life and Health Insurance Co. agreed to pay a $200,000 civil penalty in settlement of allegations their previous use of the automatic default option establishing a retained asset account could result in an unsuitable arrangement for a beneficiary, in violation of state regulations.

Company: John Hancock Life Insurance Co. (USA) et al.
Description: John Hancock Life Insurance Company (USA), John Hancock Life Insurance Company of NY, and John Hancock Life and Health Insurance Company agreed to pay $900,000 to the state as part of a settlement of allegations they had inadequate procedures to ensure policies and other funds were timely investigated and paid out to beneficiaries.
